metadata.name: Windows Firewall Disabled via PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detects attempts to disable the Windows Firewall using PowerShell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell_ise.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set-netfirewallprofile ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -enabled ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' false')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -all ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('public')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('domain')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('private'))))

output.summary: Detects attempts to disable the Windows Firewall using PowerShell
